page.title: 01EDINABANE - PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: Edinbane was planned as a model village by Macleod of Greshornish over a century ago. The houses were built on the hill-face beside a line of springs. In Lower Edinbane he built a school, a hospital, a mill and an inn; the first two still occupying the same sites, but modernized and extended. Later lairds built a small hydro-electric scheme serving the lodge, the school and the hospital. When the river was low, the power sometimes failed. A private suply of spring water was piped to the same buildings and can be used today when mains water supply is interrupted. A belt of trees, planted about sixty years ago to screen the lodge acts as a windbreak in Lower Edinbane. A small hall, gifted to the township, is still used by the community.
